revised_title: Proceedings of the Royal Society Annual Meeting, June 4, 1886
tldr: The Royal Society held its annual meeting on June 4, 1886, to elect new fellows. The meeting followed the election statutes, and several candidates were successfully elected into the society. The event also admitted new members, including foreign members, and re-elected some previously suspended members.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science and Technology
